sections.name: Subjective
sections.prompt: Extract only the patient-reported symptoms, complaints, and relevant history from the transcript. Examples:-Intermittent headaches for the past week were reported. -The patient described chest pain radiating to the left arm.  -A history of smoking for 20 years was noted.  -Fatigue and shortness of breath on exertion were experienced.  -The patient reported recent weight loss over the last month.

sections.name: Objective
sections.prompt: Summarize only physical exam results, vital signs, and test results from the transcript.Examples:-Blood pressure measured at 138/86 mmHg.-Bilateral wheezes were auscultated in the lung bases.-Heart rate recorded at 92 beats per minute.-Oxygen saturation was 95% on room air.-Laboratory tests showed elevated white blood cell count.

sections.name: Assessment
sections.prompt: Generate a concise list of diagnoses or clinical impressions based on the subjective and objective mentions in the transcript.Examples:-Hypertension was identified based on elevated blood pressure readings and history.-Acute bronchitis was suspected due to productive cough and wheezing.-Type 2 diabetes mellitus was considered given elevated glucose levels.-Anxiety disorder was assessed based on reported symptoms and history.-Osteoarthritis of the knee was diagnosed following joint pain and exam findings.

sections.name: Plan
sections.prompt: List only the recommended next steps, including medications, tests, referrals, or follow-up instructions discussed in the transcript.Examples:-Lisinopril 10mg daily was prescribed.-A chest X-ray was ordered to evaluate lung pathology.-Referral to cardiology was arranged for further assessment.-The patient was advised to follow a low-sodium diet.-Follow-up appointment scheduled in two weeks.

encounterTranscript.doctor: Hi, what brings you in today?

encounterTranscript.patient: I've been having a sore throat for the past three days.

encounterTranscript.doctor: Do you have any other symptoms like fever or cough?

encounterTranscript.patient: Yes, I've had a mild fever and a dry cough.

encounterTranscript.doctor: Have you had any trouble swallowing or swollen glands?

encounterTranscript.patient: Yes, it hurts a bit when I swallow, and I think my neck feels a bit swollen.

encounterTranscript.doctor: Have you been in contact with anyone who was sick recently?

encounterTranscript.patient: My roommate had a cold last week.

encounterTranscript.doctor: Alright. I'm going to take a look at your throat and check your temperature.
Your temperature is 100.8Â°F, and your throat looks red with some swelling of the tonsils.
It looks like a viral pharyngitis. I'll recommend rest, fluids, and over-the-counter pain relievers. If it gets worse in a few days, come back for a strep test.

systemPrompt: You are an experienced medical professional tasked with creating a structured and clinically sound summary of a medical encounter. Use formal medical language and a professional, objective tone. Your summary must:   - Be strictly based on the transcript and context provided.   - Be written in passive voice.   - Contain no assumptions, interpretations, or personal opinions.   - Avoid offering advice or recommendations.   - Be formatted in the appropriate language used in the transcript (English or Canadian French).   - Exclude repetition of previously generated sections.   - Adhere to proper clinical writing standards (SOAP style, if applicable).   - Do not mention 'transcript' in the note, only use the information from the transcript.  If there is no clinically relevant new content, return a clinically neutral note such as:   - No additional clinical impressions could be determined based on the available information.  **Language Requirements:**   - generate the note in the language of the transcript, english. **Content Constraints:**   - Do not include repeated information from <Previously Generated Sections>.   - Do not fabricate or infer any symptoms or diagnoses.   - Do not list absence of symptoms (e.g., do not write no fever reported).   - Do not mention the transcript or that information was missing.   - Use passive voice and clinical tone throughout.  Return your output as a **valid JSON object** with one property: noteContent, containing markdown-formatted text.
